result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael James Ritchey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: -Restitution set at $500.00 payable to Don S., to be paid out of cash bail on deposit

-Defendant to pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments out of cash bail on deposit. If there is a remaining balance due and owing, balance to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge out of cash bail on deposit. If there is a remaining balance due and owing, balance to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all realted surcharges are to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inamkte account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-If there is a credit balance after paying restitution, Court costs, assessments and all applicable surcharges, balance to be returned to person who posted
-Pay all supervision fees
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored

-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
-No contact with Don S.
-No alcohol or illegal drugs
-No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription

-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision

-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers

timeConds.notes: -As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Corrections, straight time, forthwith. Defendant taken into custody. No good time credit. No electronic monitoring.
-Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service

Defendant Michael James Ritchey in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, with credit for 22 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Restitution set at $500.00 payable to Don S, to be paid out of cash bail on deposit 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments out of cash bail on deposit.  If there is a remaining balance due and owing, balance to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge out of cash bail on deposit.  If there is a remaining balance due and owing, balance to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-If there is a credit balance after paying restitution, Court costs, assessments and all applicable surcharges, balance to be returned to person who posted 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with Don S.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs 
-No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription
-Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 90 DAYS in the House of Corrections, straight time, forthwith.  Defendant taken into custody.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet
Justice Point Discharge Summary Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  Court will address violation on the next Court date.

Defendant Michael James Ritchey in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNT 1.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he/she may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael James Ritchey in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Michael James Ritchey in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.   DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
